intro: Leucanthemopsis cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leucanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
